unnormalised: Organic farming, eh? My nani in Kerala used to do this back in '70s! Total shuddh desi ghee stuff. No chemical ka chakkar. I remember helping her pluck tomatoes on 10/10/1980. Yield was less, but the taste? Aah! Heard IIT Kharagpur is also doing some research now. Maybe by 2025, we'll see more farms like Nani's. Gotta support farmers at the local mandi, buy organic whenever I can, even if it's a bit extra Rs. Itâ€™s like going back to our roots! Thinking of starting a small garden myself, around 17:00 hrs after work.
normalised: Organic farming, eh? My nani in Kerala used to do this back in nineteen seventies! Total shuddh desi ghee stuff. No chemical ka chakkar. I remember helping her pluck tomatoes on tenth October nineteen eighty. Yield was less, but the taste? Aah! Heard I I T Kharagpur is also doing some research now. Maybe by two thousand and twenty five, we will see more farms like Nani's. Gotta support farmers at the local mandi, buy organic whenever I can, even if it is a bit extra rupees. It is like going back to our roots! Thinking of starting a small garden myself, around five P M after work.
